Afflicted Irnakurse.name: Afflicted Irnakurse
Afflicted Irnakurse.publicNotes:
Irnakurse are surface elves who drow have subjected to particularly cruel and humiliating fleshwarping practices, as drow take special delight in the torment of their surface-dwelling kin. The process of crafting an irnakurse involves twisting an unfortunate elf into a deformed mass of misplaced limbs, loose flesh, and bony protrusions-parts that should be internal are often left on full display to the world. Irnakurse are subject to mental conditioning that causes them to hate their prior forms, and these creatures prefer to attack surface elves over all other targets.

Horrid abominations reshaped by vile alchemical magic, the two fleshwarps presented here were created by drow, who transform captured elves or xulgaths into twisted monstrosities that can then be loosed to cause havoc and terror.

Fearful Curse.name: Fearful Curse
Fearful Curse.description: The irnakurse is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}, which lowers its effective level by 1.

Mind Lash.name: Mind Lash
Mind Lash.description:
A non-evil creature hit by an irnakurse's tentacle is overwhelmed with corrupted images of a ruined life and must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:28] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 4} on a critical failure).

After attempting this save, a creature is temporarily immune to Mind Lash for 24 hours.

Soul Scream.name: Soul Scream
Soul Scream.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The irnakurse unleashes an alien shriek of nightmarish horror and pain. All non-evil creatures within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:28] save. The irnakurse can Sustain Soul Scream for up to 6 rounds; each time it does, it repeats the effect.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected, and is temporarily immune to Soul Scream for 24 hours.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is stupefied 1. Further failed saves against Soul Scream increase the condition value by 1, to a maximum of stupefied 4. Each time the character gets a full night's rest, the stupefied condition gained from Soul Scream decreases by 1.

Critical Failure As failure, except the stupefied value increases by 2 instead of by 1.

Storm of Tentacles.name: Storm of Tentacles
Storm of Tentacles.description: The irnakurse makes up to four tentacle Strikes, each against a different target. These attacks count toward the irnakurse's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after it makes all of its attacks.

Consume Tattooed Flesh.name: Consume Tattooed Flesh
Consume Tattooed Flesh.description:
Requirements Aller is adjacent to a tattooed scrap of flesh or to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour

Aller devours a bite of flesh and regains [[/r {4d6}[healing]]]{4d6 Hit Points}. If the piece of flesh was tattooed, he is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened 1} and can use this extra action to make a jaws Strike.

Aller then can't Consume Flesh for [[/br 1d4 #Consume Flesh Recharge]]{1d4 rounds}. He has one piece of tattooed flesh on his person.

Ghoul Fever.name: Ghoul Fever
Ghoul Fever.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:22]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 [[/r {2d6}[negative]]]{2d6 negative damage} and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 [[/r {2d6}[negative]]]{2d6 negative damage} and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.LHHgGSs0ELCR4CYK]{Ghoul} the next midnight.

Paralysis.name: Paralysis
Paralysis.description: Any living, non-elf creature hit by Aller's attack must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:22] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

Swift Leap.name: Swift Leap
Swift Leap.description: Aller jumps up to half his Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Consume Flesh.name: Consume Flesh
Consume Flesh.description:
Requirements Augrael is adjacent to the corpse of an undead creature that was destroyed within the last hour.

Effect Augrael devours a chunk of the destroyed undead creature and regains [[/r {2d6}[healing]]]{2d6 Hit Points}.

He can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

Ghoul Fever.name: Ghoul Fever
Ghoul Fever.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 [[/r {2d6}[negative]]]{2d6 negative damage} and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 [[/r {2d6}[negative]]]{2d6 negative damage} and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.LHHgGSs0ELCR4CYK]{Ghoul} the next midnight.

Paralysis.name: Paralysis
Paralysis.description: Any living, non-elf creature hit by Augrael's attack must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description:
Augrael deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

Swift Leap.name: Swift Leap
Swift Leap.description: Augrael jumps up to half his Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Azvalvigander.name: Azvalvigander
Azvalvigander.publicNotes:
Zebubs serve as Hell's messengers and spies. Their ability to share what they've seen with other creatures makes them especially useful-not only to other devils, but also to mortal conjurers. Some infernal lords unleash them in enormous, horrid swarms upon unsuspecting lands to debase flesh and land alike while collecting secrets the infernal host might later put to use. Zebubs use any opportunity to manipulate weak-willed or easily tempted mortals into serving the zebubs' whims. While arrogant and deceitful, zebubs lack the cunning and confidence of most devils, and thus their schemes often focus on satisfying self-serving or self-destructive ambitions. Zebubs form from the souls of childish and craven mortals, reshaped by the archdevil Baalzebul in the frozen, filthy wastes of Hell's seventh layer, Cocytus.

Each type of devil plays a particular role in Hell's bureaucracies and hierarchies, though some have far more specialized functions than others.

Infernal Eye.name: Infernal Eye
Infernal Eye.description:
The zebub records everything they see, and though they don't remember all observations, they can pass them along to another creature.

The zebub replays 10 minutes of witnessed events to a touched willing creature, which receives the memories in a flash of information. By remaining in contact, the zebub can spend additional 3-action activities to replay more information.

After relaying their visions to another, the zebub can't ever recall those events again.

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description:
The zebub's Strikes deal an additional 1d6 precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

Barbazu (AV-C24).name: Barbazu (AV-C24)
Barbazu (AV-C24).publicNotes:
Barbazus, known also as bearded devils or infantry devils, are murderous fiends who satiate their lust for annihilation by serving as the foot soldiers of Hell's armies, often leading hordes of lesser devils such as imps and lemures into battle. Bearded devils wield serrated glaives to inflict jagged gashes that resist healing magic, resulting in tremendous blood loss. When enemies come too close, bearded devils strike with the spines of their wriggling beards to deliver a wretched contagion called Avernal fever, savoring the sight of their victim's strength being slowly devoured from within.

Barbazus can be found savagely indulging the whims of evil infernal lords from all layers of Hell, rejoicing as they disseminate murder, misery, and anguish as they see fit.

Masters of corruption and architects of conquest, devils seek both to tempt mortal life to join in their pursuit of all things profane and to spread tyranny throughout all worlds. The temptations they offer mortals range from great powers granted by the signing of an infernal contract to twisted favors following a whispered pledge to a diabolic patron, or any number of even subtler exchanges. Those who succumb to these temptations find themselves consigned to an afterlife of endless torment in the pits of Hell, wherein the only hope of escape lies in the chance of being promoted to become a devil in the infernal ranks. Every devil has a specific role to play in the upkeep of the remorseless bureaucratic machine that is Hell, from soldiers and scholars to inquisitors, lawyers, judges, and executioners. Lowly lemures and imps perform subservient labor to more powerful and specialized devils, such as contract devils and erinyes, while the greatest pit fiends command entire infernal armies.

Avernal Fever.name: Avernal Fever
Avernal Fever.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:23]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 day)

Infernal Wound.name: Infernal Wound
Infernal Wound.description:
A bearded devil's glaive Strike also deals @Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Bleed1d6.success] that resists attempts to heal it.

The flat check to stop the bleeding starts at @Check[type:flat|dc:20]. The DC is reduced to @Check[type:flat|dc:15] only if the bleeding creature or an ally successfully assists with the recovery. The DC to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.MHLuKy4nQO2Z4Am1]{Administer First Aid} to a creature with an infernal wound is increased by 5.

A spellcaster or item attempting to use healing magic on a creature suffering from an infernal wound must succeed at a DC 21 counteract check or the magic fails to heal the creature.

Reposition.name: Reposition
Reposition.description:
Trigger The devil hits a creature with a glaive Strike.

Effect The devil moves the creature 5 feet in any direction. The destination square must be within reach of the devil's glaive.

This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Wriggling Beard.name: Wriggling Beard
Wriggling Beard.description:
Frequency once per round.

Effect The barbazu makes a beard Strike. This Strike ignores their multiple attack penalty and doesn't count toward that penalty.

Barbazu (AV-D3).publicNotes:

Drover's Band.name: Drover's Band
Drover's Band.description:
Activate command

Frequency once per day

Effect The Barbazu exerts his will over a mindless creature within 30 feet. If the target is a mindless creature of 3rd level or lower, it must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:20] save and uses an outcome one degree of success worse than the result of its saving throw.

Critical Success The target creature is unaffected.

Success The target creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round as its responses are muddled by the Barbazu's commands.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.9qGBRpbX9NEwtAAr]{Controlled} by the Barbazu for 1 hour, although it doesn't follow commands that are obviously self-destructive.

Critical Failure As failure, but the duration is 1 day.

Infernal Wound.name: Infernal Wound
Infernal Wound.description:
A bearded devil's glaive Strike also deals @Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Bleed1d6.success] that resists attempts to heal it.

The flat check to stop the bleeding starts at @Check[type:flat|dc:20]. The DC is reduced to @Check[type:flat|dc:15] only if the bleeding creature or an ally successfully assists with the recovery. equipment-+1 Flaming Striking Hellforged.name: +1强击炽焰地狱锻造大砍刀 Hellforged Glaive
equipment-+1 Flaming Striking Hellforged.description: 这件长兵由7英尺长杆和顶端的单刃组成。它在一定距离外进行致命的切割时，非常有效。

Avernal Fever.name: Avernal Fever
Avernal Fever.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:23]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 day)

Barcumbuk.name: Barcumbuk
Barcumbuk.publicNotes:
Erinyes exact vengeance and bloody justice for a creature's crimes, torturing and punishing their victims in ironic fashion before allowing them the escape of death. While an erinys appears as a fallen angel and the first erinyes shared that origin, erinyes now originate in myriad ways, some promoted from lesser devils and others shaped from lemures themselves forged from the souls of torturers and persecutors. The erinyes' origin is entwined with Eiseth, herself a fallen angel and one of Hell's most powerful demigods. The first erinyes were all considered to be Eiseth's metaphorical daughters, but erinyes formed since that time are no longer limited to a single gender.

Masters of corruption and architects of conquest, devils seek both to tempt mortal life to join in their pursuit of all things profane and to spread tyranny throughout all worlds. The temptations they offer mortals range from great powers granted by the signing of an infernal contract to twisted favors following a whispered pledge to a diabolic patron, or any number of even subtler exchanges. Those who succumb to these temptations find themselves consigned to an afterlife of endless torment in the pits of Hell, wherein the only hope of escape lies in the chance of being promoted to become a devil in the infernal ranks. Every devil has a specific role to play in the upkeep of the remorseless bureaucratic machine that is Hell, from soldiers and scholars to inquisitors, lawyers, judges, and executioners. Lowly lemures and imps perform subservient labor to more powerful and specialized devils, such as contract devils and erinyes, while the greatest pit fiends command entire infernal armies.

Flames of Fury.name: Flames of Fury
Flames of Fury.description: Any weapon an erinys holds gains the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.XszNvxnymWYRaoTp]{Flaming} rune while they hold it.

Furious Fusillade.name: Furious Fusillade
Furious Fusillade.description: The erinys hovers in place if they are flying and fires one arrow at any number of creatures in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30]. Each attack is rolled separately. This counts as one attack for the purpose of the erinys's multiple attack penalty.

Rope Snare.name: Rope Snare
Rope Snare.description:
An erinys carries a coil of rope woven of their hair (use the statistics for @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.fyYnQf1NAx9fWFaS]{Rope}) that animates in their hands.

When a creature is hit by the erinys's rope, a segment of the rope tears loose and wraps itself around the creature, imposing a 10-foot circumstance penalty to Speed. The piece that tears off is 10 feet long for a Medium or smaller creature, and doubles in length for each size larger than Medium.

When a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes} the effect (DC 26), the detached segment of rope withers away into useless black sludge.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.o0zqsH5kYopRanav]{Effect: Rope Snare}

Befuddling Gas Trap.name: Befuddling Gas Trap
Befuddling Gas Trap.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:33|name:Disable Hidden Mechanism|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to disable the hidden mechanism on the north wall, immediately sucking the gas from the room, or @Check[type:thievery|dc:29|name:Plug One Nozzle|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) to adequately plug one of the seven nozzles. When all seven nozzles are plugged or destroyed, the trap is deactivated.
Befuddling Gas Trap.hazarddescription: Seven nozzles hidden within holes in the 15‑foot-high ceiling release a poison gas.
Befuddling Gas Trap.reset: After an hour, the trap deactivates; the gas disperses slowly, and the doors can be opened again. After 24 hours, the gas builds up and the trap can be triggered again.
Befuddling Gas Trap.routine:
(1 action) The gas intensifies. Each creature in the room must make a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:30].

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and becomes temporarily immune to the gas for 1 hour, though if the creature has already been stupefied by the trap, that condition remains for its normal duration.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 24 hours. If the target is already stupefied, the condition value increases by 1 (to a maximum of stupefied 4) and the target takes [[/r {8d6}[mental]]]{8d6 mental damage}.

Critical Effect As failure, except the target takes double the mental damage.
Befuddling Gas Trap.stealthdetails: +21 (expert) or @Check[type:perception|dc:31|traits:action:seek] (expert) to notice the hidden override mechanism in the north wall

Gas Release.name: Gas Release
Gas Release.description:
Trigger Both secret doors are closed and at least one creature is in the room

Effect Gas fills the chamber. Creatures within the chamber must succeed on a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:30] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure). The trap then rolls initiative.

Magic Sense.name: Magic Sense
Magic Sense.description: Belcorra can sense the presence of magic auras as though she were always using a 1st-level @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.gpzpAAAJ1Lza2JVl]{Detect Magic} spell. When she @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seeks}, she gains the benefits of a 3rd-level detect magic spell on things she sees.

Site Bound.name: Site Bound
Site Bound.description:
Lowest three levels of the Abomination Vaults

A typical ghost can stray only a short distance from where it was killed or the place it haunts. A typical limit is 120 feet. Some ghosts are instead bound to a room, building, item, or creature that was special to it rather than a location.

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description:
When Belcorra is destroyed, she re-forms in [[/br 2d4 #Rejuvenation]]{2d4 days} within the Empty Vault (though she can reduce that time by empowering herself with glimmers of Nhimbaloth's essence using the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.CTiLugp5ptSItEqN]{Ebon Fulcrum Lens}).

Belcorra can only be permanently destroyed if she enacts her full revenge on Absalom or if Nhimbaloth devours her soul.

Blood Magic.name: Blood Magic
Blood Magic.description:
Each time Belcorra casts a sorcerer bloodline spell or an aberrant bloodline granted spell, she can grant herself or a target of the spell a +2 status bonus to Will saving throws for 1 round.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.4GAJHkurmZ1ttKDv]{Effect: Blood Magic}

Corrupting Gaze.name: Corrupting Gaze
Corrupting Gaze.description:
Belcorra stares at a creature she can see within 30 feet. The target takes [[/r {9d6}[mental]]]{9d6 mental damage} (@Check[type:will|dc:33|basic:true] save).

A creature that fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 minute.

Haunted Lighthouse.name: Haunted Lighthouse
Haunted Lighthouse.description:
Frequency once every 10 minutes

Effect Belcorra extends her presence throughout the lowest three levels of Gauntlight until the end of her next turn. She can see with the benefits of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.9qV49KjZujZnSp6w]{All-Around Vision} and can make ghostly hand attacks or use special abilities originating from any surface in this area.

Quickened Casting.name: Quickened Casting
Quickened Casting.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect If Belcorra's next action is to cast a sorcerer spell of 4th level or lower, she reduces the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum 1 action).

Blast Tumbler.name: Blast Tumbler
Blast Tumbler.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:32|name:Disarm the Rune|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to disarm the rune, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (5th level; counteract DC 28) to counteract the rune's magic.
Blast Tumbler.hazarddescription: A hard-to-reach rune is placed on the lock's tumbler. It emits a blast of force when the door is jostled.
Blast Tumbler.reset: The rune resets 1 minute after it triggers.

Force Blast.name: Force Blast
Force Blast.description:
Trigger A non‑undead creature opens the door or critically fails an attempt to disarm or dispel the rune

Effect A 30‑foot cone of force issues forth from the lock. Creatures within the cone must succeed a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:29|basic:true] saving throw or take [[/r {8d12}[force]]]{8d12 force damage}. Those who fail the save are pushed 10 feet, and those who critically fail are pushed 20 feet and are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}.

Blood of Belcorra.name: Blood of Belcorra
Blood of Belcorra.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:22|name:Wipe Away Blood] (trained) to wipe away enough of the bloodstain to disrupt the haunt's necromantic energies, or @Check[type:religion|dc:20|name:Excorcise Haunt] (trained) to exorcise the haunt
Blood of Belcorra.hazarddescription: A bloody image of Belcorra arises, emits a soul‑draining light, then inhales blood from living creatures in the room.
Blood of Belcorra.reset:
If the haunt is disabled or destroyed through damage, the bloody phantom of Belcorra sprays upward in a spiral, dousing the trap door leading to area A25 before draining upward through the keyhole, which reduces the Thievery DC to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.2EE4aF4SZpYf0R6H]{Pick the Lock} to @Check[type:thievery|dc:20|name:Pick Trap Door|traits:action:pick-a-lock,skill,manipulate].

At the next sunrise, the blood drains back down to this room and the haunt resets. The haunt is destroyed permanently once Lasda Venkervale is rescued from area D9.
Blood of Belcorra.routine:
(1 action) The bloody image opens its mouth and appears to inhale, drawing blood from the body of one creature in its line of sight within 90 feet from the center of area A11. The creature targeted must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Bleed1d10.success].

Failure The creature takes [[/r {1d10+6}[persistent,bleed]]] @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage}.

Critical Failure The creature takes [[/r {2d10+6}[persistent,bleed]]] @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage} and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} as long as it's bleeding.

Gauntlight Beam.name: Gauntlight Beam
Gauntlight Beam.description:
Trigger A living creature ends its turn in area A11 at night

Effect A ghastly image of Belcorra, seemingly composed of fresh blood, rises from the bloodstain on the floor and rotates in place like a lighthouse. Beams of cold blue light shine from Belcorra's eyes and open mouth, causing blisters and decay to spread across flesh. Living creatures within a @Template[type:burst|distance:30] from the center of area A11 must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20|traits:damaging-effect] save.

The haunt then rolls initiative.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes [[/r {1d8}[negative]]]{1d8 negative damage}.

Failure The creature takes [[/r {1d8+6}[negative]]]{1d8+6 negative damage} and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature takes [[/r {2d8+6}[negative]]]{2d8+6 negative damage} and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round then dazzled for 1 round.

Death Burst.name: Death Burst
Death Burst.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:20]{20-foot area} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

When the bloodsiphon dies, its body explodes in a cloudy red burst of necrotic dried blood in a 20-foot area.

Creatures in range must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:21|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes [[/r {2d6}[negative]]]{2d6 negative damage}.

Failure The creature takes [[/r {4d6}[negative]]]{4d6 negative damage}.

Critical Failure The creature takes [[/r {6d6}[negative]]]{6d6 negative damage} and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 hour.

Blood Drain.name: Blood Drain
Blood Drain.description:
Requirements The bloodsiphon has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}

Effect The bloodsiphon drains blood from the creature it has grabbed. This deals [[/r {4d4}]]{4d4 damage} and the bloodsiphon grows temporarily moist and slimy as it regains [[/r {8}[healing]]]{8 Hit Points}, gaining any excess as temporary Hit Points that last for 1 minute.

A creature that has its blood drained by the bloodsiphon is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} until it receives any type of healing.

Loose Bones.name: Loose Bones
Loose Bones.description: A critical hit jostles the skeleton's loose bones, making it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}. Additional critical hits increase this value, up to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 4}.

Broad Swipe.name: Broad Swipe
Broad Swipe.description: The skeleton makes two Strikes with its claw against two adjacent foes, both of whom are within its reach. The multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks are resolved.

Terrifying Charge.name: Terrifying Charge
Terrifying Charge.description: The skeleton Strides and makes a claw Strike with a +4 circumstance bonus to damage. If the Strike hits, it attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} the target.

Self-Loathing.name: Self-Loathing
Self-Loathing.description: A mitflit's self-loathing makes it easy to influence. It takes a -4 penalty to its Will DC against checks to Coerce, Demoralize, Make an Impression, and Request.

Vermin Empathy.name: Vermin Empathy
Vermin Empathy.description: Mitflits can use Diplomacy to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression} on and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.DCb62iCBrJXy0Ik6]{Request} things of arthropods (insects, spiders, scorpions, crabs, and similar invertebrate animals). Most arthropods have a starting attitude of indifferent to mitflits.

Spear Frog Poison.name: Spear Frog Poison
Spear Frog Poison.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:15]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r {1d4}[poison]]]{1d4 poison damage} (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r {1d6}[poison]]]{1d6 poison damage} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Vengeful Anger.name: Vengeful Anger
Vengeful Anger.description: As long as it isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened}, a mitflit gains a [[/r +2 # status bonus to damage rolls against a creature that has previously damage]] status bonus to damage rolls against a creature that has previously damaged or tormented it.

Bright Walker.name: Bright Walker
Bright Walker.publicNotes: Those who encounter calignis quickly learn that their deaths involve burning out instead of bleeding out. At times, this dramatic immolation is denied to a caligni, so they arise as a bright walker. Tied to caligni society, these creatures don't understand that their glow damages and repels living calignis. Despite their name, these undead don't walk; they instead float a few inches above the ground.

Bright Release.name: Bright Release
Bright Release.description:
When a bright walker is reduced to 0 Hit Points, they flash out in a burst of light, obtaining the blazing end they were denied at death. This blaze deals [[/r {10d6}[fire]]]{10d6 fire damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:25|basic:true] save) to creatures within @Template[type:emanation|distance:20]{20 feet}.

Creatures who fail this save are also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 minute (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 minute on a critical failure).

Light Aura.name: Light Aura
Light Aura.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

The bright walker sheds bright light. Any creature that starts its turn in the aura must attempt at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:24] save.

Critical Success The creature is temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature is blinded for 1 hour.

Suppress Aura.name: Suppress Aura
Suppress Aura.description: The bright walker suppresses their light aura for 1 round, reducing it to a faint, ghostly glow of dim light.

Landbound.name: Landbound
Landbound.description: A bright walker can't fly higher than 1 foot above the ground. If they fly higher than this distance, they fall but don't take any damage from falling.

Light Flare.name: Light Flare
Light Flare.description:
Requirement The bright walker's Light Aura is suppressed

Effect The bright walker reignites their Light Aura with a burst of brightness that deals [[/r {5d6}[fire]]]{5d6 fire damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:25|basic:true] save) to creatures within a @Template[type:burst|distance:20].

Creatures who are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} or with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.I0HYG0ctCLP5JRsW]{Light Blindness} find this flare particularly painful; such a creature's save result is one degree of success worse than the result it rolled.

Shadow Jump.name: Shadow Jump
Shadow Jump.description:
Requirement The bright walker's Light Aura is suppressed

Effect The bright walker teleports to a square it can see within 60 feet that is not in an area of bright light. The bright walker can't use again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Shadow Jump]]{1d4 rounds}.

Bravery.name: Bravery
Bravery.description: When the caligni defender rolls a success on a Will save against a fear effect, they get a critical success instead. In addition, any time they gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition, reduce its value by 1.

Death Flame.name: Death Flame
Death Flame.description: When the caligni defender dies, their body combusts in a flash of white-hot flame. All creatures in a @Template[type:burst|distance:20] take [[/r {6d10}[fire]]]{6d10 fire damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:26|basic:true] save). Their gear and treasure are unaffected by the flames and are left in a pile where they died.

Black Smear Poison.name: Black Smear Poison
Black Smear Poison.description:
Many calignis use a debilitating poison crafted from subterranean fungi.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:16|traits:alchemical,injury,poison]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r {1d6}[poison]]]{1d6 poison damage} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 As stage 1

Stage 3 [[/r {1d6}[poison]]]{1d6 poison damage}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)

Shoulder to Shoulder.name: Shoulder to Shoulder
Shoulder to Shoulder.description: When adjacent to one or more defenders they can see, the defender deals an additional [[/r {2d6}]]{2d6 damage} with their Strikes.

equipment-Lump of Decayed Flesh Strung o.name: Lump of Decayed Flesh Strung on a Necklace

Consume Flesh.name: Consume Flesh
Consume Flesh.description:
Requirements The Canker cultist is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour, or is carrying a specially prepared lump of decaying flesh.

Effect The Canker cultist devours a chunk of the corpse or the lump of decaying flesh and regains Hit Points. They regain [[/r {1d6}[healing]]]{1d6 Hit Points} from consuming the flesh of a creature that died within the last hour, and [[/r {2d6}[healing]]]{2d6 Hit Points} from the lump.

The cultist can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

Ghoul Fever.name: Ghoul Fever
Ghoul Fever.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 [[/r {2d6}[negative]]]{2d6 negative damage} and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 [[/r {2d6}[negative]]]{2d6 negative damage} and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.LHHgGSs0ELCR4CYK]{Ghoul} the next midnight.

Paralysis.name: Paralysis
Paralysis.description: Any living, non-elf creature hit by a Canker cultist's attack must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

Swift Leap.name: Swift Leap
Swift Leap.description: The cultist jumps up to half its Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Skillful Catch.name: Skillful Catch
Skillful Catch.description:
Trigger Carman is targeted with a ranged attack by a thrown weapon and has a hand free

Effect Carman gains a +2 circumstance bonus to his AC against the triggering attack. If the attack misses, Carman catches the weapon and can immediately make a ranged Strike with it.

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description:
Carman deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

Sudden Throw.name: Sudden Throw
Sudden Throw.description: Carman quickly draws a thrown weapon and makes a ranged Strike with it. His target must succeed at a @Check[type:perception|dc:22] check or be caught @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} by the attack.

Surprise Attacker.name: Surprise Attacker
Surprise Attacker.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} to Carman.

Despair.name: Despair
Despair.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

Living creatures are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} while in Chafkhem's despair aura. They can't naturally recover from this fear while in the area but recover instantly once they leave it. When a creature first enters the area, it must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:24] save (after taking the penalty from being frightened) or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round.

The creature is then temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description: When Chafkhem is destroyed, necromantic energies rebuild his body in the magic circle in his room over [[/br 1d10 #Rejuvenation]]{1d10 days}. If the re-forming body is destroyed during that time, the process starts anew. Chafkhem can be destroyed for good with a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Dbd5W6G8U2vzWolN]{Consecrate} ritual, or if the magic circle is destroyed.

Warding Script.name: Warding Script
Warding Script.description:
Trigger A creature Chafkhem can see makes a melee Strike against Chafkhem

Effect Chafkhem traces a magical glyph in the air that glows and fades. The triggering creature must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25] save.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} until the start of its next turn.

Critical Failure The target is blinded for 1 minute.

Mummy Rot.name: Mummy Rot
Mummy Rot.description:
This disease and any damage from it can't be healed until this curse is removed. A creature killed by mummy rot turns to dust and can't be resurrected except by a 7th-level @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.kqhPt9344UkcGVYO]{Resurrect} ritual or similar magic.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:24]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 minute)

Stage 2 [[/r {6d6}[negative]]]{6d6 negative damage} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 day)

Site Bound.name: Site Bound
Site Bound.description:
Area C36 and C37.

A typical ghost can stray only a short distance from where it was killed or the place it haunts. A typical limit is 120 feet. Some ghosts are instead bound to a room, building, item, or creature that was special to it rather than a location.

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description:
To put Chandriu to rest permanently, a hero must convince her to stop pining over Volluk with a successful @Check[type:diplomacy|dc:21|name:Convince Chandriu|overrideTraits:true] check.

Regardless of the result of this check, Chandriu flies into a rage and attacks, but if the Diplomacy check is successful, she is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 10 rounds while she fights. If defeated while she is slowed, she is put to rest.

When a ghost is destroyed, it re-forms after [[/br 2d4 #days]]{2d4 days} within the location it's bound to, fully healed. A ghost can be permanently destroyed only if someone determines the reason for its existence and sets right whatever prevents the spirit from resting.

Despairing Cry.name: Despairing Cry
Despairing Cry.description:
Chandriu wails in despair at her loss and betrayal, forcing each living creature within 30 feet to attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:24] save.

On a failure, a creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} on a critical failure) for 1 round as they are overcome with sadness over their own missed opportunities. On a success, a creature is temporarily immune to Chandriu's Despairing Cry for 1 minute.

Corpselight.name: Corpselight
Corpselight.senses: corpse sense (精确感官) 30 尺, 黑暗视觉
Corpselight.publicNotes: A will-o'-wisp that starves to death might rise as a cold, blue, glowing sphere of spongy wetness-a corpselight. A corpselight instinctively seeks out a host corpse to dwell within, as its physical form quickly deteriorates if not hidden within a dead creature.

Corpse Sense (Precise) 30 feet.name: Corpse Sense (Precise) 30 feet
Corpse Sense (Precise) 30 feet.description: A corpselight can sense dead bodies within range. This is a precise sense that functions through solid barriers less than 5 feet thick.

Sunlight Powerlessness.name: Sunlight Powerlessness
Sunlight Powerlessness.description: A corpselight exposed to sunlight is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, and cannot Claim a Corpse.

Wisp Form.name: Wisp Form
Wisp Form.description:
When a corpselight is reduced to 0 Hit Points while merged with a corpse, it is instead reduced to 1 Hit Point as the corpse collapses to the ground and the corpselight emerges in its wisp form.

While in wisp form, a corpselight is Tiny and can take no actions other than Claim Corpse or Fly.

A corpselight that starts its turn in wisp form must attempt a @Check[type:flat|dc:16|immutable:true] at the end of its turn; if it fails, it loses 1 Hit Point. A corpselight reduced to 0 Hit Points while in wisp form is destroyed.

Claim Corpse.name: Claim Corpse
Claim Corpse.description:
Prerequisites The corpselight is in wisp form and is adjacent to a Medium or Small corpse that hasn't been claimed by a corpselight in the past 24 hours

Effect The corpselight merges with the corpse, causes the corpse to Stand, and regains [[/r {3d6}[healing]]]{3d6 Hit Points}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.auJ02rr1Jr88oD3Z]{Effect: Claim Corpse - Fleshy}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.3np7EyJ8pyrVlpie]{Effect: Claim Corpse - Skeletal}

Death Light.name: Death Light
Death Light.description:
Prerequisites The corpselight is in a corpse

Effect The corpselight emits a sickly blue beam of light from its mouth and eyes in a @Template[type:cone|distance:20]. All living creatures in this area must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:18|traits:damaging-effect] saving throw. If at least 1 creature fails its save, the corpselight regains [[/r {2d6}[healing]]]{2d6 Hit Points}, gaining any that exceed its maximum as temporary Hit Points that last for 1 minute.

The corpselight can't use again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Death Light]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes [[/r {1d6}[negative]]]{1d6 negative damage}.

Failure The creature takes [[/r {2d6}[negative]]]{2d6 negative damage} and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Critical Failure The creature takes [[/r {4d6}[negative]]]{4d6 negative damage} and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}.

Cratonys.name: Cratonys
Cratonys.publicNotes:
Evangelists, the velstracs' unofficial ambassadors, roam the farthest reaches of the planes to spread the word of their kind's abhorrent belief in perfection through pain. They are therefore the most frequently encountered velstracs on the Material Plane, leading covens of hedonistic mortal flesh-sculptors or serving as wardens of horrific dungeons. In regions ruled by infernal powers, evangelists may serve as lieutenants or advisors, whispering secret paths to power in exchange for mortal's souls or choice mortal flesh. Evangelists are the same size as humans, although with the heavy chains that always drape their forms, they often weigh 350 pounds or more.

The search for ultimate sensation through self-mutilation is the horrifying preoccupation of the shadow-dwelling fiends known as velstracs. They transcend their stoic detachment only when inflicting pain and terror upon their victims, practicing new forms of torture, or when turning their agonizing practices back on themselves. Velstracs consider themselves enlightened beings, transcending such limitations as morality or mortal taboos, but their victims know them as emotionless tormentors who inflict sadistic suffering. These fiends claim to seek perfection in thought, form, and action, although they don't recognize any refinement that doesn't require the painful excision of the flesh or spirit.

Velstracs manifest from the souls of the most extreme masochistic or sadistic mortals who are judged and sent on to the Shadow Plane. They take on forms that suit their vile predilections, ranging from the low-ranking augurs to the maestros of suffering and mutilation called eremites. The process of transformation warps the soul step by step, with other velstracs conveying their new members through untold chambers of pain among the dark reaches of the Shadow Plane.

Painsight.name: Painsight
Painsight.description: A velstrac automatically knows whether a creature it sees has any of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Yl48xTdMh3aeQYL2]{Wounded} conditions, as well as the value of those conditions

Unnerving Gaze.name: Unnerving Gaze
Unnerving Gaze.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

When a creature ends its turn in the aura, it sees the face of a departed loved one in place of the evangelist's face. The creature must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:21] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} on a critical failure).

Animate Chains.name: Animate Chains
Animate Chains.description: Chains in the evangelist's vicinity sprout barbs and writhe menacingly. The evangelist can make chain Strikes against any creature that is adjacent to an unattended chain within 20 feet, in addition to those within the reach of the evangelist's chain Strike.

Focus Gaze.name: Focus Gaze
Focus Gaze.description:
The evangelist stares at a creature they can see within 30 feet. The target must immediately attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:21] save against Unnerving gaze. In addition, if the creature was already @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened}, on a failed save, the evangelist is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} from the creature for as long as the creature remains frightened.

After attempting this save, the creature is then temporarily immune until the start of the evangelist's next turn.

Impaling Chain.name: Impaling Chain
Impaling Chain.description: When the evangelist critically hits with a chain Strike, the target is impaled and anchored in place, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the chain. The creature is unable to recover from @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage} damage until it gets free (Escape DC 25).

Rusty Chains.name: Rusty Chains
Rusty Chains.description:
When Cratonys damages a creature with her chains, including persistent bleed damage from being impaled by a chain, the creature must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:21|traits:disease,virulent] saving throw or contract a severe form of tetanus called velstrac tetanus.

Velstracs sometimes intentionally infect their chains with dangerous diseases, such as this aggressive form of tetanus. Tetanus can produce stiffness, muscle spasms strong enough to break bones, and ultimately death.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:21|traits:disease,virulent]

Onset [[/br 1d4 #Velstrac Tetanus Onset]]{1d4 days}

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 week)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} and can't speak (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} (1 day)

Stage 4 death

Daemonic Fog.name: Daemonic Fog
Daemonic Fog.disable: @Check[type:survival|dc:28|name:Disrupt the Fog] (expert) to disrupt the fog before the hazard triggers or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (5th level; counteract DC 26) to counteract the magic.
Daemonic Fog.hazarddescription: The fog solidifies into tiny, gnawing creatures that devour everyone within before fading back into mist.
Daemonic Fog.reset: The hazard resets over the course of an hour as the daemonic stain reenergizes the fog.

Gnawing Fog.name: Gnawing Fog
Gnawing Fog.description:
Trigger A creature crosses the cavern's midpoint (the dotted line on the map)

Effect The hazard deals [[/r {9d6}[piercing]]]{9d6 piercing damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:32|basic:true] save) to the triggering creature and all other non‑fiend creatures within 20 feet. A creature that critically fails the saving throw is confused for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Deepwater Dhuthorex.name: Deepwater Dhuthorex
Deepwater Dhuthorex.publicNotes:
The typical dhuthorex is a dumb and hungry beast, chasing prey through the depths and venturing onto land only to pursue easy prey.

Strange things swim in sunless seas, but few as fierce as the shark-like dhuthorexes. These beasts chase prey fearlessly and tenaciously.

Overpowering Jaws.name: Overpowering Jaws
Overpowering Jaws.description: A deepwater dhuthorex deals [[/r {7}[piercing]]]{7 piercing damage} to its target if its jaws Strike is a failure (but not a critical failure).

Dhuthorex Sage.name: Dhuthorex Sage
Dhuthorex Sage.publicNotes:
More intelligent than their lesser kin, dread dhuthorexes possess eerie, enchanting powers.

Strange things swim in sunless seas, but few as fierce as the shark-like dhuthorexes. These beasts chase prey fearlessly and tenaciously.

Doom of Tomorrow.name: Doom of Tomorrow
Doom of Tomorrow.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:20|name:Deactivate Model of Gauntlight|traits:magical,trap] (trained) to quickly deactivate the model of Gauntlight before it triggers, or @Check[type:stealth|dc:23|name:Creep by Trap|traits:magical,trap] (trained) to creep by a trap without triggering it.
Doom of Tomorrow.hazarddescription: The sounds of devastation rise from the diorama, and a beam of shimmering energy lances outward from the tiny model of Gauntlight.

Apocalypse Beam.name: Apocalypse Beam
Apocalypse Beam.description:
Trigger A creature steps within 10 feet of the back of a diorama alcove

Effect The trap fires an apocalypse beam at that creature.

Dragon's Blood Puffball.name: Dragon's Blood Puffball
Dragon's Blood Puffball.publicNotes:
This bulbous, deep red fungus looks like an enormous, decaying rose.

Many benign puffball fungi cling to the detritus of forest floors in Darklands caverns. These fungi's giant versions are more mobile and dangerous.

Motion Sense 60 feet.name: Motion Sense 60 feet
Motion Sense 60 feet.description: The monster senses motion through vibrations and air movement.

Spore Explosion.name: Spore Explosion
Spore Explosion.description: When the dragon's blood puffball dies, it explodes, dealing [[/r {7d8}[poison]]]{7d8 poison damage} to each creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:26|basic:true] save).

Dread Dhuthorex.name: Dread Dhuthorex
Dread Dhuthorex.publicNotes:
More intelligent than their lesser kin, dread dhuthorexes possess eerie, enchanting powers.

Strange things swim in sunless seas, but few as fierce as the shark-like dhuthorexes. These beasts chase prey fearlessly and tenaciously.

Overpowering Jaws.name: Overpowering Jaws
Overpowering Jaws.description: A dread dhuthorex deals [[/r {8}[piercing]]]{8 piercing damage} to its target if its jaws Strike is a failure (but not a critical failure).

Dread Wisp.name: Dread Wisp
Dread Wisp.publicNotes:
Will-o'-wisps native to the Darklands are more ominous and malevolent than those that bob about in the lonely marshes and surfaces of the upper world. These dread wisps instill terror with eerie shifts of light and consume the fear they create, drawing life energy from their victims in the process. While dread wisps can survive anywhere within the Darklands, they prefer moist areas like partially submerged caves, the banks of underground rivers, and towering fungus gardens.

Dread wisps don't glow as brightly as surface will-o'-wisps because even the dimmest light attracts notice underground. Long-lived and hateful creatures, they remember vivid details about their lives, travels, and most delicious prey. Although dread wisps could share extensive lore and unique experiences, they don't, as they find amusement in others' ignorance.

Dread Flickering.name: Dread Flickering
Dread Flickering.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:20]{20 feet} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

A dread wisp, though naturally invisible, glows with a grayish illumination, casting dim light in the aura and making them visible. Living creatures that end their turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:25] saving throw or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure).

Those that critically succeed are temporarily immune for 10 minutes.

Magic Immunity.name: Magic Immunity
Magic Immunity.description: A dread wisp is immune to all spells except @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.HRb2doyaLtaoCfi3]{Faerie Fire}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Magic Missile}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Oj1PJBMQD9vuwCv7]{Maze}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.DyiD239dNS7RIxZE]{Searing Light}, and spells with the positive trait.

Feed on Despair.name: Feed on Despair
Feed on Despair.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirement An enemy within 15 feet of the dread wisp is under a fear effect, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying}

Effect The dread wisp feeds on the creature's despair. The dread wisp regains [[/r {2d8}[healing]]]{2d8 Hit Points} and deals [[/r {3d8}[negative]]]{3d8 negative damage} to the creature (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:25|basic:true] save), and if the dread wisp has Gone Dark, their Dread Flickering reignites.

Go Dark.name: Go Dark
Go Dark.description: The dread wisp extinguishes their Dread Flickering, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}. They can end this effect with another use of this action. If the dread wisp uses their draining touch Strike while invisible, the arc of pale energy lets any observer determine their location, making them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} to all observers only until the dread wisp moves.

Shadow Flitter.name: Shadow Flitter
Shadow Flitter.description: The dread wisp teleports to a square they can see within 30 feet that isn't in an area of bright light. The dread wisp can't use again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Shadow Flitter]]{1d4 rounds}.

Wearying Touch.name: Wearying Touch
Wearying Touch.description: If the dread wisp critically hits with their draining touch Strike, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

Dreshkan.name: Dreshkan
Dreshkan.allSaves: 对抗流血、死亡效果、疾病、毁灭、疲乏、麻痹、毒素和恶心状态全豁免+2状态加值
Dreshkan.publicNotes:
Because morlocks are descended from distant human ancestors, clumsily or hastily fleshwarping a morlock simply produces a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.K9Hw43co8fhwmKkM]{Grothlut}. Skilled fleshwarpers, however, can tease out a morlock's genetic differences to make an entirely different creature. Creating a dreshkan involves replacing the morlock's bones with a metal skeleton. This new skeleton is often heavily augmented, such as with spiderlike limbs protruding from the spine or magazines of tiny, deadly needles. Arcane electricity courses through the dreshkan thereafter, making it jumpy and irritable.

Morlocks view dreshkans as impressive fusions of flesh and technology and gladly fight alongside these creatures, whom they view as paragons of morlock potential.

Although twisting victims into horrid shapes is a well-known pastime of evil drow, other subterranean monsters have stolen these practices or developed them independently. The worm-like seugathis sometimes warp other creatures whose territories abut their lightless lands; the fleshwarps below result from morlocks and urdefhans, respectively.

+2 status to all saves vs. bleed, death.name: 对抗流血、死亡效果、疾病、毁灭、疲乏、麻痹、毒素和恶心状态全豁免+2状态加值

Defensive Needle.name: Defensive Needle
Defensive Needle.description:
Trigger A creature critically fails a melee Strike against the dreshkan

Effect The dreshkan makes a needle Strike against that creature.

Partially Technological.name: Partially Technological
Partially Technological.description: A dreshkan is partially technological. Positive healing effects only heal a dreshkan half as much as normal.

Needle Spray.name: Needle Spray
Needle Spray.description:
The dreshkan braces itself on all four limbs and sprays needles at as many creatures as it would like in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30], dealing [[/r {2d4}[piercing]+{2d8}[electricity]]]{2d4 piercing damage plus 2d8 electricity damage}. Each targeted creature in the area must attempt a basic Reflex save.

Note: Paizo did not provide a listed DC for this ability. The suggested DC to use per the GMG is @Check[type:reflex|dc:19|basic:true]

Swarming Stance.name: Swarming Stance
Swarming Stance.description: A dreshkan can share the same space as a morlock or another dreshkan, but no more than two such creatures can occupy the same space. When these creatures share the same space, they gain a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls.

Stone Defense.name: Stone Defense
Stone Defense.description:
Trigger An enemy is about to damage the cavern seer with bludgeoning damage or with a spell that has the earth trait

Effect The cavern seer gains resistance 10 against the triggering damage.

Cavern Distortion.name: Cavern Distortion
Cavern Distortion.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements The cavern seer is underground

Effect Pebbles and dust rise from the stone to impede vision. The cavern seer and their allies within 60 feet become concealed for 1 minute.

This concealment can't be used to Hide or Sneak.

Underground Stride.name: Underground Stride
Underground Stride.description: The cavern seer ignores difficult terrain while underground.

Drow Hunter.name: Drow Hunter
Drow Hunter.publicNotes:
Hunters seek out game to keep drow communities fed and functioning.

Drow have a reputation for evil due to demon worship in their major settlements. However, like members of any ancestry, drow can have any alignment, especially when removed from the demon lords' sinister influence.

Deft Evasion.name: Deft Evasion
Deft Evasion.description: When the hunter rolls a success on a Reflex save, they get a critical success instead.

Hunter's Wound.name: Hunter's Wound
Hunter's Wound.description:
Frequency once per round

Prerequisites The hunter is wielding a ranged weapon with a reload of 0

Effect The hunter makes two ranged Strikes against their prey. If both hit and deal damage, the target takes an additional @Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Bleed1d8.success].

Skirmish Strike.name: Skirmish Strike
Skirmish Strike.description: The hunter can Step and then Strike, or Strike and then Step.

Drow Shootist.name: Drow Shootist
Drow Shootist.publicNotes:
The rare few drow who specialize in the repeating hand crossbow command respect not only for their skills but for their luck and swagger.

Drow have a reputation for evil due to demon worship in their major settlements. However, like members of any ancestry, drow can have any alignment, especially when removed from the demon lords' sinister influence.

Shootist's Luck.name: Shootist's Luck
Shootist's Luck.description:
Trigger The shootist fails a save

Frequency once per day

Effect The shootist rerolls the save and uses the better result.

Distracting Shot.name: Distracting Shot
Distracting Shot.description: The shootist takes aim and makes a ranged Strike. If the attack hits and deals damage, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} until the end of the shootist's turn, or until the end of the shootist's next turn on a critical hit.

Reloading Trick.name: Reloading Trick
Reloading Trick.description:
Requirements The shootist is holding an unloaded repeating hand crossbow

Effect The shootist Interacts to reload the repeating hand crossbow and Strikes with it.

Shootist's Draw.name: Shootist's Draw
Shootist's Draw.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The shootist Interacts to draw a repeating hand crossbow and Strikes with it, or Strikes with a loaded repeating hand crossbow they're holding then Interacts to stow it.

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description:
The shootist deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

Drow Warden.name: Drow Warden
Drow Warden.publicNotes:
Wardens watch over drow encampments and often work in small groups.

Drow have a reputation for evil due to demon worship in their major settlements. However, like members of any ancestry, drow can have any alignment, especially when removed from the demon lords' sinister influence.

Hampering Slash.name: Hampering Slash
Hampering Slash.description: A target damaged by the warden's melee Strike must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:21] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until the end of the warden's next turn.

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description:
A warden deals an extra [[/r {1d6}]]{1d6 damage} to flat-footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

Death Shadows.name: Death Shadows
Death Shadows.description:
When Dulac dies, her body is destroyed in a burst of chilling shadows. All creatures in a @Template[type:burst|distance:20] take [[/r {8d8}[cold]]]{8d8 cold damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:28|basic:true] save).

Dulac's gear and treasure are unaffected by the shadows and are left in a pile where she died.

Opportune Step.name: Opportune Step
Opportune Step.description:
Trigger A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} creature, or a creature with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.I0HYG0ctCLP5JRsW]{Light Blindness}, ends its move adjacent to Dulac

Effect Dulac Steps.

Warding Shove.name: Warding Shove
Warding Shove.description:
Trigger An ally within Dulac's reach is targeted with a ranged or melee attack by an attacker she can see

Effect The ally gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack, and the ally can Step after the attack.

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description:
Dulac deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

Dune Candle.name: Dune Candle
Dune Candle.publicNotes:
Malevolent balls of colored light, will-o'-wisps haunt lonely marshes and forests where they lure unsuspecting travelers into danger. Will-o'-wisps can vary the color and illumination they shed, and delight in mimicking bobbing lanterns or distant fires to draw lost or disoriented travelers off of safe trails. They can extinguish their illumination entirely to become invisible, and they enjoy doing so once their victims are wholly lost and have realized that the bobbing light in the distance isn't, in fact, leading them to safety. Even invisible, however, a will-o'-wisp rarely ventures far from its target, as it feasts upon the panic and dread felt by its victims.

Beneath its glow, a will-o'-wisp's body is a spongy ball approximately 1 foot in diameter and weighing less than 5 pounds. Although most will-o'-wisps are merely translucent, featureless orbs, gaining definition only in the shifting illumination they create, a few have dark mottling that makes them resemble a skull when viewed closely. Will-o'-wisps have no need for mundane nourishment, and in fact lack the ability to consume matter of any kind; they find all the sustenance they need in the terror of nearby creatures. For this reason, they like to work alongside undead that produce terror in their victims. Will-o'-wisps are long-lived, if not effectively immortal, and they have good memories. A cowed or defeated will-o'-wisp can be a good source of lore and information, though acquiring such cooperation from such a sinister monster is no easy feat.

Will-o'-wisps inhabit desolate swamps and forests and are generally active at twilight and after dark. They are therefore reluctant to lead victims into immediately fatal areas such as deadfalls, but instead prefer hazards where their victims suffer over a long time, such as pockets of stale or poisonous air, patches of quicksand, and dens of bigger monsters. According to will-o'-wisps, different types of fear have subtle differences in flavor. The lurking dread in the pit of the stomach that gnaws at those who slowly become aware of the fact that they're lost produces a much different taste than the sudden stark terror of imminent death in the face of a towering monster. Because of this, will-o'-wisps try to vary the ways in which they induce terror in their prey, to ensure they don't tire of certain flavors of fear.

These desert-based will-o'-wisps deal fire damage rather than electricity and delight in setting their victims aflame, relishing the resulting screams that echo across the landscape. They can quench their glow like other will-o'-wisps, but the nearer they remain to their burning victims, the more obvious their heat shimmer appears in the air.

Glow.name: Glow
Glow.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:20]{20 feet} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

A will-o'-wisp is itself naturally invisible, but glows with a colored light, casting bright light in the aura and making it visible.

Magic Immunity.name: Magic Immunity
Magic Immunity.description: A will-o'-wisp is immune to all spells except @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.HRb2doyaLtaoCfi3]{Faerie Fire}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.0qaqksrGGDj74HXE]{Glitterdust}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Magic Missile}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Oj1PJBMQD9vuwCv7]{Maze}.

Heat Mirage.name: Heat Mirage
Heat Mirage.description:
The dune candle extinguishes its glow, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}. It can end this effect with another use of this action. Its body reflects creatures on fire (but not other fires) while it's invisible.

As a result, when any creature within 20 feet of the dune candle is taking @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Fire Damage}, the dune candle is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} to observers rather than @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected}.

Light the Living Wick.name: Light the Living Wick
Light the Living Wick.description:
A creature damaged by a dune candle's flare Strike must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:24] save or catch on fire, taking [[/r {1d4}[persistent,fire]]] @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Fire Damage}.

If the creature is already taking persistent fire damage, a failed save increases the persistent fire damage by 1d4.

Breath of the Bog.name: Breath of the Bog
Breath of the Bog.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

A creature that begins its turn within the area feels as if its lungs were filling with water and must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:28] save or be unable to speak or breathe. The creature can still hold its breath and can attempt a new save at the end of its turn. A creature that succeeds is temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Rise Up.name: Rise Up
Rise Up.description:
Trigger A creature walks on top of a bog mummy that lies buried in the mud or peat below

Requirements Initiative has not yet been rolled

Effect The bog mummy automatically notices the creature and Burrows before rolling initiative.

Bog Rot.name: Bog Rot
Bog Rot.description:
This affliction can't be reduced below stage 1, nor can the damage from it be healed, until it's successfully treated with remove curse or a similar effect; the affliction can then be removed as normal for a disease. A creature killed by bog rot melts into a noxious sludge and can't be resurrected except by a 7th-level resurrect ritual or similar magic

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:21]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 minute)

Stage 2 [[/r {3d6}[negative]]]{3d6 negative damage} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 day)

Erinys (AV-D7).name: Erinys (AV-D7)
Erinys (AV-D7).publicNotes:
Erinyes exact vengeance and bloody justice for a creature's crimes, torturing and punishing their victims in ironic fashion before allowing them the escape of death. While an erinys appears as a fallen angel and the first erinyes shared that origin, erinyes now originate in myriad ways, some promoted from lesser devils and others shaped from lemures themselves forged from the souls of torturers and persecutors. The erinyes' origin is entwined with Eiseth, herself a fallen angel and one of Hell's most powerful demigods. The first erinyes were all considered to be Eiseth's metaphorical daughters, but erinyes formed since that time are no longer limited to a single gender.

Masters of corruption and architects of conquest, devils seek both to tempt mortal life to join in their pursuit of all things profane and to spread tyranny throughout all worlds. The temptations they offer mortals range from great powers granted by the signing of an infernal contract to twisted favors following a whispered pledge to a diabolic patron, or any number of even subtler exchanges. Those who succumb to these temptations find themselves consigned to an afterlife of endless torment in the pits of Hell, wherein the only hope of escape lies in the chance of being promoted to become a devil in the infernal ranks. Every devil has a specific role to play in the upkeep of the remorseless bureaucratic machine that is Hell, from soldiers and scholars to inquisitors, lawyers, judges, and executioners. Lowly lemures and imps perform subservient labor to more powerful and specialized devils, such as contract devils and erinyes, while the greatest pit fiends command entire infernal armies.

Flames of Fury.name: Flames of Fury
Flames of Fury.description: Any weapon an erinys holds gains the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.XszNvxnymWYRaoTp]{Flaming} rune while they hold it.

Furious Fusillade.name: Furious Fusillade
Furious Fusillade.description: The erinys hovers in place if they are flying and fires one arrow at any number of creatures in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30]. Each attack is rolled separately. This counts as one attack for the purpose of the erinys's multiple attack penalty.

Rope Snare.name: Rope Snare
Rope Snare.description:
An erinys carries a coil of rope woven of their hair (use the statistics for @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.fyYnQf1NAx9fWFaS]{Rope}) that animates in their hands.

When a creature is hit by the erinys's rope, a segment of the rope tears loose and wraps itself around the creature, imposing a 10-foot circumstance penalty to Speed. The piece that tears off is 10 feet long for a Medium or smaller creature, and doubles in length for each size larger than Medium.

When a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes} the effect (DC 26), the detached segment of rope withers away into useless black sludge.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.o0zqsH5kYopRanav]{Effect: Rope Snare}

Flickerwisp.name: Flickerwisp
Flickerwisp.publicNotes:
The dancing, twisting flickerwisp is a less powerful but no less malevolent type of will-o'-wisp. Like their more dangerous kin, flickerwisps prefer to haunt lonely swamps or stretches of lonely rivers or creeks, particularly near the shorelines where they can pass themselves off as nothing more than a small gathering of fireflies. A flickerwisp's body is a 3-foot-long length of hair-like fibers that flashes and pulses with ribbons and points of eerie yellow light as the creature flits through the air.

While a flickerwisp can taste fear, and finds the flavor delectable, it does not feed on this emotion. Instead, flickerwisps subsist on confusion and doubt. The sense of unease a traveler exudes when they become lost in the woods is flickerwisps' favorite repast. They can sip from this sense of disorientation without betraying their presence or harming their prey. Eventually, the flickerwisps grow too hungry and are compelled to flit closer, confuse their prey, and glut on the raw emotions. Flickerwisps do their best to swoop away before death occurs, and the most skilled of these tormentors can keep a chosen meal alive for days, sipping from confusion in small doses.

Glow.name: Glow
Glow.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:5]{5 feet} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

A flickerwisp is itself naturally invisible, but glows with pale yellow light, casting bright light in the aura and making it visible.

Innocuous.name: Innocuous
Innocuous.description: A flickerwisp's appearance registers strangely in the minds of creatures who are confused. A creature with the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} condition never targets a flickerwisp with attacks unless the creature has been damaged by the flickerwisp's shock ability within the last 24 hours.

Magic Immunity.name: Magic Immunity
Magic Immunity.description: A flickerwisp is immune to all spells except @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.HRb2doyaLtaoCfi3]{Faerie Fire}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.g8QqHpv2CWDwmIm1]{Gust of Wind}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Magic Missile}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Oj1PJBMQD9vuwCv7]{Maze}.

Consume Confusion.name: Consume Confusion
Consume Confusion.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirement A creature within 15 feet of the flickerwisp is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}

Effect The flickerwisp feeds on the creature's confusion, even as its flashing body and disjointed gyrations cause existing confusion effects to persist.

It regains [[/r {1d4}[healing]]]{1d4 Hit Points}, and if the creature's confused condition has a limited duration, it lasts 1 additional round.

Flicker.name: Flicker
Flicker.description:
The flickerwisp churns and flits in the air around an adjacent creature's head, and its length flashes and sparkles in a bewildering array of distracting pulsations.

The creature must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:18] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round (2 rounds on a critical failure). On a critical success, the creature is temporarily immune to for 24 hours.

Death Motes.name: Death Motes
Death Motes.description: When Galudu dies, her body explodes into brilliant motes of magical energy. All creatures in a @Template[type:burst|distance:20] take [[/r {12d6}[force]]]{12d6 force damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:30|basic:true] save). Galudu's gear is unaffected by the explosion and is left in a pile where she died.

Opportune Step.name: Opportune Step
Opportune Step.description:
Trigger A dazzled or blinded creature, or a creature with light blindness, ends its move adjacent to Galudu

Effect Galudu Steps.

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description:
Galudu deals an additional 3d6 precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

Survivor's Nourishment.name: Survivor's Nourishment
Survivor's Nourishment.description: A creature that eats food conjured by Galudu's create food spell regains [[/r {4d4}[healing]]]{4d4 Hit Points}. A creature can only benefit from this healing once per week.

Gibtanius.name: Gibtanius
Gibtanius.publicNotes:
When a gibtas feeds regularly but never receives sufficient food to procreate, it grows into a mighty gibtanius. They become surly, uncontrolled predators, forsaking their bonded masters to satiate their unending hunger.

This rubbery, spheroid scavenger is nearly all acid-dripping mouth, with five bulbous black eyes and two powerful, gangly legs. A gibtas often forms a bond with a single other creature-usually, a more powerful aberration- and serves this master loyally, if erratically. Creatures who keep a gibtas as a pet or guard soon learn to keep it away from any important possessions they don't want spattered with acid.

Powerful Stench.name: Powerful Stench
Powerful Stench.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:20]{20 feet} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

A creature that enters the aura must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26] save. On a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}; on a critical failure, the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for as long as it is sickened.

A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Bouncing Crush.name: Bouncing Crush
Bouncing Crush.description:
The gibtanius Leaps and can end this Leap occupying the same space as other creatures.

It deals [[/r {5d6}[bludgeoning]]]{5d6 bludgeoning damage} to each creature in the space it Leaps to (@Check[type:reflex|dc:26|basic:true] save), then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shoves} each of those creatures. If it fails to Shove any creature out of its space, it bounces to the closest available space of its choosing that does not contain any creatures.

Bouncing Crush counts as one attack when determining the gibtanius's multiple attack penalty.

Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
Breath Weapon.description:
The gibtanius vomits a stream of acid that deals [[/r {9d6}[acid]]]{9d6 acid damage} to all creatures in a @Template[type:line|distance:60] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:26|basic:true] save).

It can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

Gibtas Bounder.name: Gibtas Bounder
Gibtas Bounder.publicNotes:
A full-grown gibtas uses its powerful legs and rubbery body to bound great distances. Most gibtases remain solitary, unless bonded with a creature.

This rubbery, spheroid scavenger is nearly all acid-dripping mouth, with five bulbous black eyes and two powerful, gangly legs. A gibtas often forms a bond with a single other creature-usually, a more powerful aberration- and serves this master loyally, if erratically. Creatures who keep a gibtas as a pet or guard soon learn to keep it away from any important possessions they don't want spattered with acid.

Bouncing Slam.name: Bouncing Slam
Bouncing Slam.description: The gibtas Leaps toward a Medium or smaller creature, landing in the creature's space and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shoving} the creature. If the Shove fails, the gibtas bounces out of the target's square to an adjacent square of the target's choosing.

Pinning Chomp.name: Pinning Chomp
Pinning Chomp.description:
Requirements The gibtas's last action was a Bouncing Slam and the gibtas successfully Shoved the target

Effect The gibtas attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} the target of its Bouncing Slam, then makes a jaws Strike against the target. The Trip and Strike both count against the gibtas's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks.

Gibtas Spawn Swarm.name: Gibtas Spawn Swarm
Gibtas Spawn Swarm.publicNotes:
When a gibtas gorges itself on an incredible amount of flesh, it vomits up a pool of acid filled with tiny pink egg sacs that burst immediately. The new babies hunt as a pack, growing in size until they go their separate ways or consume each other.

This rubbery, spheroid scavenger is nearly all acid-dripping mouth, with five bulbous black eyes and two powerful, gangly legs. A gibtas often forms a bond with a single other creature-usually, a more powerful aberration- and serves this master loyally, if erratically. Creatures who keep a gibtas as a pet or guard soon learn to keep it away from any important possessions they don't want spattered with acid.
